info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM MDT... At 955 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Rhea to 7 miles southwest of Texico. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Farwell, Texico and Pleasant Hill. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 390 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
